page.title: 14Hampton Foot Ferry, Evesham.
page.content: Some{monks}lived in Evesham Abbey about 9OO years ago. On the other side of the river was their{vineyard}on Clarke's Hill. They needed to get across so they made a{ferry.}They stored their wine in the{cellars of {the Ferry House.}Nowadays the ferry {opens 8.a.m. till dusk.}On a busy day they have 4OO-5OO{passengers},normally they would have l5O. Mr. Huxley taught the Children of Hampton to swim. His daughter,{Mrs. Raphael, now owns the {Ferry.}One night a car came down Boat Lane. The driver thought the river was a ford so he carried on and the car sank into the river. The driver escaped. Each{boat}lasts about 3O years; they get across by pulling a {rope.}If another boat comes to the ferry it sounds it's horn and the ferry rope is lowered under the water.
